heisig_chinese_memo: To make a trendy bamboo basket use bamboo for the body and handle and silk gauze for a cute little covering.
Ru_trainchinese: luó: (сущ) бамбуковая корзина с квадратным дном
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To make a trendy bamboo basket use bamboo for the body and handle and silk gauze for a cute little covering.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Bamboo " to " Luo " sound. The original meaning is a container made of bamboo or wicker. "dialect. "Fifth": "Ji, Chen, Wei, Song, Chu, and so on." "Bamboo Department": "Luo, bamboo ware." For example, Fan Chengda of the Southern Song Dynasty "The sound of selling fish and vegetables outside the wall in the snow is very bitter." Cold." Ming Feng Menglong's "Three Sui Ping Yao Biography" Chapter 25: "The sailor tied the wheel, the copper bell, and the bamboo basket, and everything is complete."

" Luo " can also be used as a quantifier. Such as "Song History. Shihuo Zhi 2": "Two-way salt with one hundred thousand baskets as the amount. For three years, the increase in losses is to increase the amount." Yuan dynasty Lutang "Mountain Residence": "Hanging the barren path on the slope , Half a basket of red millet Qianxi pound."
humanum_short_description_en: From " bamboo " to " luo " sound. The original meaning is a container made of bamboo or wicker.
humanum_full_description:
從「竹」，「羅」聲。本義是以竹或柳條編成的盛物器。《方言．第五》：「箕，陳魏宋楚之間謂之籮。」《玉篇．竹部》：「籮，竹器也。」如南宋范成大〈雪中聞牆外䰞魚菜者求售之聲甚苦有感〉：「飯籮驅出敢偷閒，雪脛冰鬚慣忍寒。」明代馮夢龍《三遂平妖傳》第25回：「水手扎縛了轆轤、銅鈴、竹籮，俱完備了。」

　　「籮」也可作量詞。如《宋史．食貨志下》：「兩路鹽且以十萬籮為額，俟三數年，視其增虧，乃增其額。」元代栯堂〈山居〉：「荒徑攲斜挂籊蓬，半籮紅粟倩溪舂。」
humanum_short_description: 從「竹」，「羅」聲。本義是以竹或柳條編成的盛物器。

籮筐 [ luó kuāng ]: large wicker basket
(Simplified: 箩)
Pictophonetic: 羅 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
Chinese: To make a trendy bamboo basket use bamboo for the body and handle and silk gauze for a cute little covering.
Meaning: bamboo basket
Hanzi: 箩
Story: To make a trendy bamboo basket use bamboo for the body and handle and silk gauze for a cute little covering.
Kind: traditional

從「 竹 」，「 羅 」聲。本義是以竹或柳條編成的盛物器。《方言．第五》：「箕，陳魏宋楚之間謂之籮。」《玉篇．竹部》：「籮，竹器也。」如南宋范成大〈雪中聞牆外䰞魚菜者求售之聲甚苦有感〉：「飯籮驅出敢偷閒，雪脛冰鬚慣忍寒。」明代馮夢龍《三遂平妖傳》第25回：「水手扎縛了轆轤、銅鈴、竹籮，俱完備了。」 「 籮 」也可作量詞。如《宋史．食貨志下》：「兩路鹽且以十萬籮為額，俟三數年，視其增虧，乃增其額。」元代栯堂〈山居〉：「荒徑攲斜挂籊蓬，半籮紅粟倩溪舂。」
From " Bamboo" to " Luo" sound. The original meaning is a container made of bamboo or wicker. "dialect. "Fifth": "Ji, Chen, Wei, Song, Chu, and so on." "Bamboo Department": "Luo, bamboo ware." For example, Fan Chengda of the Southern Song Dynasty "The sound of selling fish and vegetables outside the wall in the snow is very bitter." Cold." Ming Feng Menglong's "Three Sui Ping Yao Biography" Chapter 25: "The sailor tied the wheel, the copper bell, and the bamboo basket, and everything is complete." " Luo" can also be used as a quantifier. Such as "Song History. Shihuo Zhi 2": "Two-way salt with one hundred thousand baskets as the amount. For three years, the increase in losses is to increase the amount." Yuan dynasty Lutang "Mountain Residence": "Hanging the barren path on the slope , Half a basket of red millet Qianxi pound."

籮字的基本解释

籮
luó
见“箩”。

籮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［luó］
［《廣韻》魯何切，平歌，來。］
“箩1”的繁体字。
(1)竹器，大多方底圆口。制作较细致。大的口侧有两耳，常用来盛米谷等物，可容一斛；小的可用来淘米。
(2)量词。

籮字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　籮； 康熙笔画：25； 页码：页906第07
【廣韻】魯何切【集韻】【韻會】良何切【正韻】郞何切，?音羅。竹器。【揚子·方言】箕，陳魏宋楚之閒謂之籮。一說江南謂筐底方上圜曰籮。

籮字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
籮字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Luo
luó

Luo
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［luó］
["Guangyun" Lu Heqie, Ping Ge, come. ]
"箩1" in traditional characters.
(1) Bamboo ware, mostly with square bottom and round mouth. The production is more detailed. The large mouth has two ears, which are often used to hold rice and other things, and can hold a small amount of dendrobium.
(2) Quantifiers.
Luo
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set on] [Bamboo Character Department] 　箩; Kangxi Strokes: 25; Page Number: Page 906 Page 07
[Guang Yun] Lu Heqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Liang Heqie [Zheng Yun] Yin Heqie,? Yin Luo. Bamboo ware. [Yangtze Dialect] Kei, Chen, Wei, Song and Chu's leisurely call it a basket. One said that Jiangnan said that the upper side of the basket was called Luo.
